page.title: 01Ardentinny & Glen Finart
page.content: The deep glaciated valley of Glen Finart runs south east to the shores og Loch Long. Steep mountains rise on either side of the alluvial flats of the glen, composed of schhistose rocks. Land use reflects the high rainfall. The hillsides up to 300 metres are largely planted with conifers with rough hill grazing above. The valley bottom is poorly drained and is predominantly used for grazing sheep and cattle. From lower Glen Finart the scattered village of Ardentinny spreads south along the shore of Loch Long. The main sources of employment for inhabitants are the outdoor education centre, the hotel and forestry. Many of the village houses are holiday homes or occupied by Donoon commuters.
